intro: Rotheca hirsuta, commonly known as hairy rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in the summer. Rotheca hirsuta typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
